intro: Mikania hesperia, commonly known as the showy musk vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are heart-shaped, hairy, and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Mikania hesperia is often found growing in moist, disturbed areas such as riverbanks and forest edges.
